Dispute_Type: Credibility assessment, failure to consider objective evidence
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in concluding lack of credibility and failing to assess objective evidence of persecution risk
Credibility_Assessment: Negative credibility finding based on inconsistencies in testimony and documentation
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, documentary evidence, country condition evidence
Basis_of_Claim: Political opinion as a member of the MDC in Zimbabwe
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility of the applicant and existence of objective evidence of risk
Application_Error: Failure to consider objective evidence despite negative credibility finding
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside and remitted for redetermination
Assessment_Standard: Patently unreasonable standard for credibility findings
Evidence_Ignored: Objective evidence regarding persecution of MDC members in Zimbabwe
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Procedural fairness, legal error in evidence assessment
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Credibility findings are entitled to deference unless patently unreasonable; objective evidence must be considered
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility and perceived lack of objective fear
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistencies in applicant's account, lack of corroborating documents
Procedural_Fairness: Board failed to properly consider relevant evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of credibility assessment and omission of objective evidence
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada (Federal Court jurisdiction over IRB decisions)
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Procedural_Issue: Failure to address all relevant factors in decision
Omission_Type: Failure to consider objective evidence of country conditions
